thread.title: Interviews next week for Ole Miss chancellor candidates
thread.title_full: Interviews next week for Ole Miss chancellor candidates - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Interviews next week for Ole Miss chancellor candidates
text:
By JEFF AMY
Associated Press JACKSON, Miss. (AP) - College Board trustees will start interviewing candidates to become the next chancellor of the University of Mississippi next week.
The board's search committee is scheduled to meet Tuesday and Wednesday at the University of Mississippi Medical Center in Jackson. Board President Alan Perry of Jackson says trustees will conduct the first round of interviews, seeking a replacement for former Chancellor Dan Jones.
Perry won't say how many candidates the board is interviewing, whether any are Ole Miss alumni, or whether any now lead other schools. Trustees typically seek to keep presidential searches secret.
Board members say they hope to name a new chancellor by year's end.
Trustees declined to renew Jones' contract, citing concerns about contract management at the medical center. That decision prompted protests by students, faculty and alumni.
